channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My Property Manager Robbed and Ghosted Me ($40K Stolen!)
item.description: If you get your property management wrong, you could lose tens of thousands of dollars. A sketchy property manager could take all your rent and run, leaving you with the […]

item.title: Fisker’s troubled Ocean SUV gets its first recall
item.description: Fisker is issuing the first recall for its all-electric Ocean SUV because of problems with the warning lights, according to new information published by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The safety agency says that the Fisker Ocean’s instrument panel displays the brake, park, and antilock brake system warning lights in the wrong font size […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 5 Takeaways From Our Series on St. Louis Homicide Investigations
item.description: The police department has struggled to solve homicides, partly due to shoddy detective work, staffing shortages and eroding community trust.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: 5 Mistakes to Avoid When You Start Investing in Real Estate
item.description: Before you start investing in real estate, make sure you hear this episode. Almost every beginner ends up making these five big real estate investing mistakes. Some cost money, some […]

item.title: Gorilla, a Belgian startup that helps energy providers crunch big data, raises $25M
item.description: Gorilla, a Belgian company that serves the energy sector with real-time data and analytics for pricing and forecasting, has raised €23 million ($25 million) in a Series B round led by U.S. venture capital firm Headline. Founded in 2018, Antwerp-based Gorilla works with energy providers across Europe, the U.S. and Australia, including British Gas’ parent […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Were in a Mental Health Crisis at a Hospital. This Is How They Landed in Jail.
item.description: Washington, like most states, has a law intended to protect health care workers. Instead, it’s led to prosecutions of people with severe mental illness.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: First Time Landlord Checklist: The 9 Essential Steps
item.description: In this first time landlord checklist, you’ll discover nine essential steps that can give you the confidence you need to become the landlord you want to be

item.title: Fabless AI chip makers Rebellions and Sapeon to merge as competition heats up in global AI hardware industry
item.description: South Korea’s fabless AI chip industry saw a slew of fundraising events over the last couple of years as demand for hardware to power AI applications skyrocketed, and it seems the space is already consolidating. Two of the country’s prominent fabless AI chip startups, Rebellions and Sapeon, have agreed to merge, the companies said on […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Why Some States are Trying to Get People Medicaid Before They Leave Prison
item.description: People leaving prisons and jails are at greater risk of illness and death, but for years they couldn’t use the government health insurance program.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: Seeing Greene: I Can’t Find Tenants! Should I Sell or Lower My Rent?
item.description: Your rental properties are sitting vacant—what do you do? Do you sell or lower your rent price to spark some interest? Will reducing your rent open you up to bad […]

item.title: The apps that Apple Sherlocked at WWDC 2024
item.description: Here's a list of third-party apps that were Sherlocked by Apple at this year's WWDC. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: St. Louis Homicide Cases Often Go Unsolved. Victims’ Families Want Justice.
item.description: These St. Louis families have waited years for answers. They say police seem to have forgotten their loved ones.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: My Property Manager Robbed and Ghosted Me ($40K Stolen!)
item.description: If you get your property management wrong, you could lose tens of thousands of dollars. A sketchy property manager could take all your rent and run, leaving you with the […]

item.title: Germany’s Black Semiconductor raises $273M for graphene-based chip connectivity tech
item.description: Black Semiconductor, which is developing a chip-connecting technology based on graphene, has raised $273M in a combination of private and public funding. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: As Murders Increased, St. Louis Police Struggled for Resources to Solve Cases
item.description: The city’s homicide unit has dealt with short staffing, long hours and a ballooning DNA backlog.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
